overview: Analysing and comparing costs with results involves a particular set of thinking and tasks – including economic methods of evaluation as well as wider considerations. In this subject, students will focus on developing the basic skills and knowledge needed to engage with evaluation in this area appropriately and effectively in their own practice.
ilo: Describe and distinguish ways of evaluating costs against results
Identify and critique basic problems with economic evaluation
Appropriately use results of economic evaluation in reporting and decision-making
Apply basics of economic evaluation methods appropriately in a variety of situations

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Major written task: case report on value for money
